thinking.disposable_income: McKinley Park has a median household income of $70,411, with about 36.4% of households earning less than $50,000. The per capita income of $32,106 suggests moderate disposable income levels, making residents somewhat sensitive to transportation costs
thinking.discretionary_consumption: Given the income distribution, many households have limited discretionary spending capacity. Higher sales taxes would impact household budgets, especially for the 36.4% lower-income households who spend a larger portion of their income on necessities
thinking.accessibility: The community shows diverse transportation usage: 51.5% drive alone, 21.7% use transit, and 12.7% carpool. 87.7% of households own at least one vehicle, but significant transit usage indicates good transit access and importance of maintaining affordable transit options
thinking.decision_rationale: 1. Prioritized policies that balance moderate transit fares with lower sales tax burden, considering the significant portion of lower-income households. 2. Selected options that improve transit times without excessive driving fees, given the high car ownership and driving rates. 3. Considered the substantial transit-using population (21.7%) by ensuring transit remains affordable and efficient. 4. Avoided highest tax rates (1.5%) due to impact on discretionary spending. 5. Balanced driving fees to improve transit service without overly burdening the majority who drive
